solution_line_template: Bill needs {gallons_per_room} * {num_bedrooms} = <<{gallons_per_room}*{num_bedrooms}={color_paint_gallons}>>{color_paint_gallons} gallons of color paint for the {num_bedrooms} bedrooms.
Thus, he needs {color_paint_gallons} / {color_can_size} = <<{color_paint_gallons}/{color_can_size}={color_paint_cans}>>{color_paint_cans} cans of color paint for the bedrooms.
There are {other_rooms_multiplier} * {num_bedrooms} = <<{other_rooms_multiplier}*{num_bedrooms}={num_other_rooms}>>{num_other_rooms} other rooms in the house.
He needs {gallons_per_room} * {num_other_rooms} = <<{gallons_per_room}*{num_other_rooms}={white_paint_gallons}>>{white_paint_gallons} gallons of white paint for the other rooms.
Thus, he needs {white_paint_gallons} / {white_can_size} = <<{white_paint_gallons}/{white_can_size}={white_paint_cans}>>{white_paint_cans} cans of white paint.
In all, Bill needs {white_paint_cans} + {color_paint_cans} = <<{white_paint_cans}+{color_paint_cans}={total_cans}>>{total_cans} cans of paint for the whole house.
